definition: ode/eulogy/to praise in writing/to wish (in letters)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Trivial tributes constitute the attribute of constituent's report.
sentences.chinese: 瑣屑的頌詞形成選民的報告的屬性。

sentences.english: Eulogiums will not bias me; i shall judge for myself .
sentences.chinese: 頌詞是不會使我有偏見的，我要自己作判斷。

sentences.english: Trivial tributes constitute the attribute of constituent' s report.
sentences.chinese: 瑣屑的頌詞形成選民的報告的屬性。

sentences.english: Some of his friends delivered an eulogy .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友致了頌詞。

sentences.english: Speak to one another with psalms, hymns and spiritual songs.
sentences.chinese: 當用詩章，頌詞，靈歌，彼此對說。

sentences.english: Trivial tributes constitute the attribute of constituent’s report.
sentences.chinese: 瑣屑的頌詞形成選民的報告的屬性。

sentences.english: The pastor began his eulogy. It was a tribute to both Dad and the dog who had changed his life.
sentences.chinese: 牧師開始念頌詞，悼念爸爸和狗改變了他的生活。

sentences.english: It's sort of like the clothes you want the person giving a eulogy to wear.
sentences.chinese: 這就像是你要給頌詞人選參謀衣服一樣。

sentences.english: Imagine your perfect eulogy, then build your statement on that.
sentences.chinese: 想像你那完美的頌詞，然後據此寫下你的宣言。

sentences.english: He pronounced a eulogy upon the hero .

definition: lit. paper has become expensive in Luoyang (because everyone is making a copy of a popular story) (idiom)/fig. (of a product) to sell like hotcakes
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
